Title: VM - Purge Voter

Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing Voter
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Step Expected: Voter Search page is displayed

Step Action: Use the search criteria to search for that voter
Step Expected: Voter is displayed below

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Purge"
Step Expected: A pop-up box will display asking the user if they want to Purge the Voter

Step Action: Click "Cancel"
Step Expected: The pop-up box will close and the Voter is not Purged

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "View"
Step Expected: View Information page is displayed

Step Action: Scroll down to the bottom of the page
Step Expected: "Purge" button will be present

Step Action: Click "Purge"
Step Expected: A pop-up box will display asking the user if they want to Purge the Voter

Step Action: Click "Ok"
Step Expected: A success notification will be displayed and the user is taken back to the Search Voter page

Step Action: Use the search criteria to search for that Voter again
Step Expected: Page will display no results

Title: 77170 - VM - Edit Voter - Unable to edit any voter

Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing Voter
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Step Expected: Voter Search page is displayed

Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Edit"
Step Expected: Voter Registration page is displayed

Step Expected: No changes made

Step Expected: There are no changes between Voter Details and Updated Voter Details

Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and the user is taken to the Final Screen

Step Expected: Voter Search page is displayed

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Expected: Voter Registration page is displayed

Step Action: Scroll down to the bottom and click "NEXT"

Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and the user is taken to the Final Screen

Step Action: Check page
Step Expected: The changes you made will be reflected on this page (Only certain main fields are on this page so not all changes will be visible here e.g. Phone Number)

Title: 69476 - VM - Voter's Preferred Language Selection

Step Action: Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Step Expected: Voter Search page will be displayed

Step Action: Click "Search" and then click "Add"
Step Expected: Voter Registration page is displayed

Step Action: Fill in all required fields
Step Expected: Fields filled

Step Action: Under the Voter Details section click on the "Preferred Language" dropdown
Step Expected:
The dropdown will open with the following options (Possibility of more options in the future):- English
- Spanish
- Vietnamese
- Mandarin

Step Action: Select a Preferred Language
Step Expected: Language selected

Step Action: Scroll down and click "Next"
Step Expected: Review Screen will be displayed and the Preferred Language will be shown

Step Action: Scroll down and click "Register Voter"
Step Expected: Final Screen is displayed and the Preferred Language will be shown here too

Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Step Expected: Voter Search page will be displayed

Step Action: Use the search criteria to find the voter you just created
Step Expected: Voter listed

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Voter
Step Expected: Options listed

Step Action: Click "View"
Step Expected: View Voter Registration page is displayed

Step Action: Check page
Step Expected: Preferred Language will be shown here

Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Step Expected: Voter Search page will be displayed

Step Action: Use the search criteria to find the same voter
Step Expected: Voter listed

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Voter
Step Expected: Options listed

Step Action: Click "Edit"
Step Expected: Update Voter page is displayed

Step Action: Under the Voter Details section select a different Preferred Language
Step Expected: Different Language selected

Step Action: Scroll down and click "Next"
Step Expected: Review Screen is displayed and the updated Preferred Language is shown

Step Action: Scroll down and click "Register Voter"
Step Expected: Final Screen is displayed and the updated Preferred Language will be shown here too

Title: 69301 - VM - Participation - Voter Participation Add/Maintain

Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have an existing Active Voter
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Step Expected: Search Voter page is displayed

Step Action: Use the search criteria to find your existing Voter
Step Expected: Voter found

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the existing voter
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "View"
Step Expected: View Voter page is displayed

Step Action: Click on the "Participation History" tab
Step Expected: Participation History area is displayed

Step Action: Click "ADD"
Step Expected:
The Add Participation page is displayed and the following fields are present in this order:

 - Election Date (required field)

 - Election Name (Required field)

 - Party (Primary Only)

 - Method of Request (required dropdown: choices to be Election Day, Absentee, UOCAVA, Vote Center)

 - Request Location (required dropdown: dependent on Method of Request like a specific polling location)

 - Ballot Sent Date (Required)

 - Ballot Received Date (Required)

 - Ballot Return Method (Required dropdown, dependent on method of request)

 - Ballot Status (Required)

 - Ballot Status Reason (required, dropdown dependent on Ballot Status)

 - Checkbox for "Provisional" ballot (optional)

 - If Provisional is checked then the below should display
*Provisional Status (Required)
*Provisional Status Reason (Optional)

 - Comments text box

Step Action: Click "CANCEL"
Step Expected: The user is taken back to the Participation History list and the record is not created

Step Action: Click "ADD"
Step Expected: The Add Participation page is displayed

Step Action: Click "CREATE"
Step Expected: The record will not be created and all required fields will show as red

Step Action: Fill in all required fields
Step Expected: Fields filled in

Step Action: Click "CREATE"
Step Expected: The record will be successfully created and the user is taken back to the Participation History list where they can see the new record they just created

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Participation History record you created
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Edit"
Step Expected: Maintain Participation History page is displayed

Step Action: Make any desired change and click "UPDATE"
Step Expected: The record will be updated successfully and you will be able to see the changes reflected in the Participation History list

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Participation History record you just updated
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Delete"
Step Expected: A confirmation box is displayed

Step Action: Click "Cancel"
Step Expected: The record will not be deleted

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Delete"
Step Expected: A confirmation box is displayed

Step Action: Click "Ok"
Step Expected: The record will be deleted successfully

Step Action: In the navigation tabs click on "Audit History"
Step Expected:
All Participation History actions will be displayed here:
- Add
- Update
- Delete

- Have an existing Business Address

Step Action: Click SUBMIT
Step Expected: Address will be accepted

Step Action: In the "Street No." fields enter a street number that is inside the business address range
Step Expected: Street number entered

Step Action: Click SUBMIT
Step Expected: The address will not be submitted and a message will display to the user stating that business addresses are not acceptable

Title: VM - Display Voter's Polling Location in Registration flow

Navigate to Voter registration
VM > Search > Click 'Search'> Click 'Add'

Land on 'Review' screen
'Polling Place' field appears in 'Precinct Details Review' area, displaying the appropriate polling place for the precinct the address is tied to.

Step Expected:
Land on ''Final' screen
Polling place appears and displays the correct Polling place for the address previously submitted

Title: VM - Healthcare Facility Address Indicator

Step Action: Pre-Test Data: You will need to locate or enter a 'Special Address' that is setup as a 'Health Care Facility'. This is done through the 'Special Address' screen within District Management.

Navigate to 'Voter Registration'
 Voter Management > Search > 'Add'
Step Expected: Land on the 'Voter Registration' page

Step Action: Scroll down to 'Residential Address' and enter the HCF street in the 'Search Street Name' field. Click 'Search'
Step Expected: Search modal appears with correct results

Step Action: Select the street from the list within the modal, and click 'Select'
Step Expected: Modal closes

Step Action: Enter a valid Low-Hi address number for the HCF in the 'Street No' field. Click 'Submit'
Step Expected: The address is accepted, and 'Healthcare Facility (HCF)' Is displayed in red text beneath the 'City' field.

Step Action: Fill all other mandatory fields on the page, then click 'Next'
Step Expected:
Land on 'Review Screen'
Healthcare Facility (HCF)'  appears in red to the right of the residential address field.

Step Action: Fill all mandatory fields on the page and click 'Register Voter'
Step Expected:
Land on 'Final Screen'
'Healthcare Facility (HCF)'  is displayed in red text in  below the "address" field

Step Action:
Navigate to the ' View Voter Registration' Screen
Voter Management > Voter Search > Search for the voter that added in the last step.
Step Expected: 'Healthcare Facility (HCF)' is displayed beneath the 'Residential Address' field.

Title: EMS - VM - Voter Search

Step Action: Open the application and login as county user and navigate to VM Module
Step Expected: VM home page is displayed

Step Action: Click on the Voter button
Step Expected: Voter Search page is displayed

Step Action: Select the search context: State or County from the County or State Search Selector dropdown.
Step Expected: User can select State or County. If State is selected, the search queries the entire state; if County is selected, it filters by county.

Step Action:
Fill in one or more search fields: 
 - Last Name 
 - First Name 
 - Date of Birth 
 - Driver's License/State ID 
 - SSN 
 - Street No. 
 - Street Name 
 - Apt/Unit No. 
 - City 
 - Zip Code 
 - Voter Status
Step Expected: Fields are filled with appropriate search criteria.

Step Action: Optionally, use wildcard search in any of the fields (e.g., %Jones, Jo%, %DES%).
Step Expected: Wildcard characters are used and partial matches are expected (e.g., %Jones returns "Jones," "Johnson").

Step Action: Click on the Search button.
Step Expected: The system processes the search query and displays results based on the entered search criteria.

Step Action: Review the search results displayed in the results grid.
Step Expected:
The following details should be displayed for each voter: 
 - Last Name 
 - First Name 
 - Date of Birth 
 - Street Name 
 - City 
 - Zip Code 
 - Voter Status 
 - County (when logged in as a Region user) 
 - Precinct

Step Action: If search results are paginated, use the pagination controls to navigate between pages (e.g., Next, Previous).
Step Expected: Pagination should work, allowing users to navigate through multiple pages of search results.

Step Action: Click the Manage option in the Actions menu next to any voter.
Step Expected: Clicking Manage opens the voter details screen for viewing voter information.

Step Action: Optionally, click Reset to clear all search fields.
Step Expected: The search form should reset, clearing all previously entered search criteria.
